intro: Ceropegia ampliata, commonly known as the broadleaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, often violet or white, flowers that are adapted for specific pollinators, such as certain moths. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and can vary in size depending on environmental conditions. Ceropegia ampliata is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental flowers and ease of care.
